citation.article-title: Description of Pandoraea gen. nov. with Pandoraea apista sp. nov., Pandoraea pulmonicola sp. nov., Pandoraea pnomenusa sp. nov., Pandoraea sputorum sp. nov. and Pandoraea norimbergensis comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pandoraea pulmonicola sp. nov.
Pandoraea pulmonicola (pul.mo.ni'co.la. L. n. pulmo lung; L. suf. cola dwelling, occurring in ; N.L. n. pulmonicola occurring in lungs)
The description of P. pulmonicola is the same as that for the genus.

Additional characteristics are: no growth on acetamide, or in 3.0 or 4.5% NaCl; no fluorescence on King's B medium; no assimilation of maltose, adipate or sucrose; no nitrate reduction; no amylase, urease, arginine dihydrolase, C4-esterase, C8- ester lipase or cysteine arylamidase activity present; growth at 42 °C; growth in O/F medium with glucose and on cetrimide agar; assimilation of caprate, citrate, DL-lactate and D-glucose; oxidase and phosphoamidase activity present.
The major fatty acids are 16:0, 17:0 cyclo, 19:0 cyclo ω8c and summed feature 3.
Isolated from sputum of CF patients.
The type strain is LMG 18106T (=CCUG 38759T), isolated from sputum of a CF patient in Canada.
The description of the type strain is the same as that given above for the species.
Its G­+C content is 61.8 mol% and the GenBank accession number for its 16S rDNA sequence is AF139175.
